author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> @vdWijden, its seems that the geth test vectors expect receiptsRoot whilst the spec declares receiptRoot on ExecutionPayload.
- Spec: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/v1.0.0-alpha.1/src/engine/interop/specification.md
- Geth example: https://notes.ethereum.org/@9AeMAlpyQYaAAyuj47BzRw/rkwW3ceVY#Execute-the-payload

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> Also, the spec uses blockNumber whilst the test vectors use number.

author: bridge-bot
content: <tersec> https://notes.ethereum.org/@9AeMAlpyQYaAAyuj47BzRw/rkwW3ceVY doesn't even mention blockNumber, which I had to add to the executePayload step to get through

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> I think it uses block instead of blockNumber. (re @tersec: https://notes.ethereum.org/@9AeMAlpyQYaAAyuj47BzRw/rkwW3ceVY doesn't even mention blockNumber, which I had to add to the executePayload step to get through)

author: bridge-bot
content: <tersec> oops, indeed.

author: bridge-bot
content: <tersec> I can get most of them to match, and get a SUCCESS response where it should appear, without any of the failure messages occurring, but also, https://notes.ethereum.org/@9AeMAlpyQYaAAyuj47BzRw/rkwW3ceVY#Prepare-a-payload produces "{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":67,"result":"0x0"}", not the payloadId version for me

author: bridge-bot
content: <tersec> The Geth console shows various "Producing block                          parentHash=a0513a..d67131" without error, and the results keep counting up (so result:0x1, result:0x2, etc). Seems to work, but not in the exact format the specs and test vectors show.

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> I'm just getting to that one too. I think Geth should indeed return "{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":67,"result":"0x0"}" rather than "payloadId":"0x0".

author: bridge-bot
content: <tersec> https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/interop/specification.md#returns show payloadId

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> I calls the value payloadId, but it's returning a QUANTITY not an Object so I don't think it should include field names.

author: bridge-bot
content: <tersec> So this would just be an issue with the test vectors, not the Geth implementation or spec, the least harmful scenario.

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> I agree ‚ò∫Ô∏è (re @tersec: So this would just be an issue with the test vectors, not the Geth implementation or spec, the least harmful scenario.)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> I found another one with engine_forkchoiceUpdated having a capital C for Choice in the vectors but not in the spec.
I created a comment on the relevant PR: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/23607#issuecomment-930668512
I'll just add them there instead of making noise here.

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> Oh I see the main branch of the execution API spec branch has been changed so this returns an Object. So, I think the test vectors are correct. (re @sigpaul: I calls the value payloadId, but it's returning a QUANTITY not an Object so I don't think it should include field names.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> the main branch has but not the interop version we're aiming for üòÄ this change has been done after the spec freeze and isn't that important for interop (re @sigpaul: Oh I see the main branch of the execution API spec branch has been changed so this returns an Object. So, I think the test vectors are correct.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <tersec> It's not important in terms of one being significantly different than the other, but it is important that everyone agree what the correct version is for the next week and a half.

author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> To all implementers. We will likely do more changes to the specs and their versions will go beyond the ones that are freezed for Interop. Pls, take this into account and use the interop specs. We will make an announcemnt here of any important updates that changes the interop versions

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> I just implemented the version on main üòÖ I can change again though. The main version is consistent with the other responses, which is nice.

author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> yeah and this is one of the reasons of why it was proposed, credits to @protolambda (re @sigpaul: I just implemented the version on main üòÖ I can change again though. The main version is consistent with the other responses, which is nice.)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<tersec> Even with either
miner.setEtherbase("0xa94f5374fce5edbc8e2a8697c15331677e6ebf0b") or
--miner.etherbase 0xa94f5374fce5edbc8e2a8697c15331677e6ebf0b
(both acknowledged by Geth)
The getPayload response contains: "coinbase":"0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000"

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> Regarding this, my preference would be to cut a new release on the execution API that includes the object response and then target that. There's already confusion so we might as well upgrade everyone.
No worries if cutting a release is hard or there are other breaking things in there, though. I can downgrade easily enough. (re @n0ble: yeah and this is one of the reasons of why it was proposed, credits to @protolambda)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> cc: @lightclient

author: bridge-bot
content:
<n0ble> If there is nobody opposed to (from those who has already implemented engine_preparePayload on both sides of the stack) then we may cut a release with the following change: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/77
This is the only substantial change to the Engine API since the initial release of interop edition

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> Nice, y'all found all the bugs I had :D so there were some issues in the implementation (receiptsRoot, number, payloadid object) that I fixed yesterday without recreating the test vectors. So the vectors were out of date. Regarding the etherbase, that's also expected, as the feeRecipient is set to all 0 instead of the etherbase address. Good catch withthe fork(c)hoiceUpdated, I will fix that and regenerate the test vectors today

content: <sigpaul> Thanks @vdWijden!

author: marekm3498
content:
The Nethermind WIP PR is here:
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/pull/3453

We're passing the tests vectors (with small exception - check below), and we'll continue testing. Thanks <@!360491619402776577> for the test vectors.

I found two small things in test vectors:
1. In get payload we have "baseFeePerGas":"0x0" IMO, It should be "baseFeePerGas":"0x7". I think the execution client should fail with 0x0.  (cc:<@!360491619402776577>)
2. The port is 8545 https://notes.ethereum.org/@9AeMAlpyQYaAAyuj47BzRw/rkwW3ceVY and in the spec is 8550: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/v1.0.0-alpha.1/src/engine/interop/specification.md
It will be nice to use to have the same port.

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> FYI: currently the consensus specs define the extra_data field as a SSZ byte list with a limit of 32 bytes. This is kind of a bad hybrid between dynamic size like eth1, and 32 byte graffiti like in eth2. If you prepare an execution genesis config, and plan to start a consensus chain with merge at slot 0, then make sure you keep the extra-data short enough. I'd like to change this type definition to either be fixed-length 32 bytes, or have more capacity, but we'll stick to the current thing for interop stability
